tit.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 藤原 為房（ふじわら の ためふさ、永承4年（1049年） － 永久 (元号)3年4月2日 (旧暦)（1115年4月27日））は、平安時代後期の公家。
sen.e: Born in 1049 and gone in 1115, - in detail, the date he was gone is April 2 by the lunar calendar (April 27 by the solar calendar) - FUJIWARA no Tamefusa was a Court noble in the late Heian period.

Born in 1049 and passed away in 1115, - specifically he passed away on April 2 by the lunar calendar (April 27 by the solar calendar) - FUJIWARA no Tamefusa was a Court noble in the late Heian period.
Born in 1049 and passed away on May 4, 1115, FUJIWARA no Tamefusa was a Court noble in the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正、訳文を一部変更

sen.j: 父は藤原隆方（正四位上但馬守）。
sen.e: His father was "FUJIWARA no Takakata," who rose to "Shosiinojo" (Senior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) & "Tajima no kami" (the governor of Tajima Province).
His father was "FUJIWARA no Takakata," who rose to "Shosiinojo" (Senior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) & "Tajima no kami" (the governor of Tajima Province).
His father was FUJIWARA no Takakata, who rose to Shosiinojo (Senior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) and the Governor of Tajima Province.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除、&→andに修正、「但馬守」→the Governor of Tajima Provinceとしました。

sen.j: 母は平行親（右衛門権佐）の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of "TAIRA no Yukichika" who rose to "Uemon Gon no suke" (provisional assistant captain of the Right Division of Outer Palace Guards).
His mother was a daughter of "TAIRA no Yukichika" who rose to "Uemon Gon no suke" (provisional assistant captain of the Right Division of Outer Palace Guards).
His mother was a daughter of TAIRA no Yukichika who rose to Uemon Gon no suke (provisional assistant captain of the Right Division of Outer Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除

sen.j: 室に美濃国守源頼国女・僧位隆尊女らがおり、子に藤原為隆（吉田家・万里小路家祖）、藤原顕隆（葉室家祖）、僧寛信らがいる。
sen.e: He had some wives, such as the daughter of "MINAMOTO no Yorikuni" ["Mino no kuni no kami" (the governor of Mino Province)] & the daughter of "Ryuson" at "Soi" (the rank of Buddhist priest), and he had some children, such as "FUJIWARA no Tametaka" [the founder of the Yoshida & Madenokoji family], "FUJIWARA no Akitaka" [the founder of the Hamuro family], a Buddhist priest Kanshin.

He had multiple wives, such as the daughter of "MINAMOTO no Yorikuni" ["Mino no kuni no kami" (the governor of Mino Province)] & the daughter of "Ryuson" at "Soi" (the rank of Buddhist priest), and he had some children, such as "FUJIWARA no Tametaka" [the founder of the Yoshida & Madenokoji family], "FUJIWARA no Akitaka" [the founder of the Hamuro family], a Buddhist priest Kanshin.

He had multiple wives, such as the daughter of MINAMOTO no Yorikuni, the Governor of Mino Province and the daughter of Ryuson at Soi (the rank of Buddhist priest), and he had some children, such as FUJIWARA no Tametaka (the founder of the Yoshida and Madenokoji families), FUJIWARA no Akitaka (the founder of the Hamuro family), a Buddhist priest Kanshin.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除、&→andに修正、「美濃国守」→the Governor of Mino Provinceとし、補足の[]→()に変更、the Yoshida and Madenokoji familiesに修正

sen.j: 博学で実務にあたり、のちの勧修寺流一門の繁栄の基礎を築いた。
sen.e: He did practical works with his wide knowledge, laying the foundation of the prosperity in later years of the Kajuji line of the Fujiwara clan.
He carried out practical works with his wide range of knowledge, laying the foundation for the prosperity in later years of the Kajuji line of the Fujiwara clan.
He carried out practical works with his wide range of knowledge, laying the foundation for the prosperity in later years of the Kajuji line of the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 日記に「為房卿記」がある。
sen.e: He left behind his diary "Tamefusakyo ki" (Record of the Lord Tamefusa).
He left behind his diary "Tamefusakyo ki" (Record of the Lord Tamefusa).
He left behind his diary 'Tamefusakyo Ki' (Record of the Lord Tamefusa).
sen.cmt: Tamefusakyo Kiとし、シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 大江匡房・藤原伊房と共に「前の三房」と称される。
sen.e: Together with "OE no Masafusa" & "FUJIWARA no Korefusa," he was called "saki no sanbo" (former three fusas).
Together with "OE no Masafusa" & "FUJIWARA no Korefusa," he was called "saki no sanbo" (former three fusas).
Together with OE no Masafusa and FUJIWARA no Korefusa, he was called 'saki no sanbo' (former three fusas).
sen.cmt: クォーテーション削除、&→andに修正、シングルクォーテーションに変更

sen.j: 経歴

Career
Career

sen.j: 康平8年（1065年） 縫殿権助
sen.e: In the year 1065 - "Nuidono Gon no suke" (Provisional Assistant Director in the Bureau of the Wardrobe and Court Ladies)

sen.e: In the year 1075 - "Totomi no kuni no kami" (the governor of Totomi Province)

sen.e: In the year of 1077 - "Chugu shojo"/"Chugu shosin" (Junior Secretary in the Office of the Consort's Household)

sen.j: 承暦4年（1080年） 従五位上、正五位下
sen.e: In the year 1080 - "Jugoinojo" (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), then "Shogoinoge" (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)
In the year 1080 - "Jugoinojo" (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade), then "Shogoinoge" (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade)

sen.e: In the year 1092 - He was demoted to "Awa no Gon no kami" (Provisional Governor of Awa Province) by the protest of both Enryaku-ji Temple & Hiyoshi-jinja Shrine.

sen.e: In the year 1093 - He was allowed to return to Kyoto.

sen.e: In the year 1108 - Under Emperor Toba, he held "Kurodo no to" (Head Chamberlain) and additionally "Kura no kami" (Director in the Bureau of Palace Storehouses).
